fields.name: Creating Media
fields.description: Facilitates adding media files to the site.

fields.name: Using Media
fields.description: Using media files as content on the site.

fields.name: Selecting Media
fields.description: A workflow for selecting media files.

fields.name: Media Field
fields.description: An entity field that uses OMBU Media file selection.

fields.name: Discovery
fields.description: The first phase of the project, where we gather all kinds of information about it.

fields.name: Icebox
fields.description: Where requirements chill until they're ready for action.

fields.name: Accepted
fields.description: Requirements that are ready to go.

fields.name: Administrator
fields.description: A person that administers the site and can change site-wide settings.

fields.name: Editor
fields.description: A person who can edit content on the site.

fields.name: Visitor
fields.description: Someone who visits and consumes the site.

fields.requirement: I can create a media asset by uploading a file of a valid format: .zip, .doc(x), .xls(x), ppt(x),  .pdf, .jpg, .png
I can create a video media asset by providing a Vimeo URL
After uploading a new media assets, I can categorize it, tag it, and provide other metadata
When I use a image media asset, it will automatically be scaled and cropped appropriately by the CMS for the various contexts in which it might appear
When creating content on the site, I can choose assets from the Media Library to place in my content
While viewing media that was embedded in an RTE, I see the fully rendered asset in the style selected by the editor
When embedding media into an RTE, the result is a single HTML tag with necessary medatada in data attributes
I can filter media items by name
I can view a paginated grid of all media items sorted by upload date
When building a website, I can add a Media field to content that would allow administrators to select media from the Media Library, prefiltered by any of the filters available in the Media Library
When adding a file field I can define which file types the widget will allow for upload, browsing and selection.
Meet with and collect requirements from client.
